function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Contribution of automation to the growing skill premium and rising inequality","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Industries with higher automation face lower risk of contagion, leading to lower exposure to lockdown-related risks.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Jobless recoveries are documented after large negative shocks like recessions and pandemics, leading to slow employment recovery.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Global financial crises and pandemics accelerate routine-biased technological change, leading to slow job recovery and increased inequality.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Layoffs have been higher in industries that can be automated, increasing the risk of permanent job losses during the recovery.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in robot adoption after pandemics","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"High robot density leading to increased inequality","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Acceleration of automation and robotization driving inequality","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Acceleration of automation and robotization","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in telework and automation due to covid-19","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of personal protective measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective public health messaging","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Simplified model assumptions may not be generalizable across all settings","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of factors that can negatively impact the efficacy of vector control, such as insecticide resistance and improper choice of insecticide","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of seasonal fluctuation in mosquito biting habits, leading to inaccurate representations of disease transmission","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Focus on general mosquito bite prevention may overshadow the importance of disease prevention messages.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in outbreak timing across patches","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of personal protection measures without local vector control","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of concern for disease and concern for bites on disease burden","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Individuals reassessing their use of personal protection based on concern for disease and being bitten","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Semi-arbitrary choice of 2 days for length of time in the protected class","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Utilizing the parameter for distribution of susceptible individuals between protected and unprotected classes to adjust initial conditions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High community-level control","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low community-level control of vector spread","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of personal protection impact on outbreak size","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of personal protection measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate community-level vector control","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sensitivity to parameters with semi-arbitrary values","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on human mobility for the spatial spread of the virus may lead to uncontrolled propagation in densely populated areas with high mobility.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Environmental concern regarding pesticide use can lead to a decrease in demand for mosquito control measures, impacting the control of disease-carrying mosquitoes.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases through human mobility","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited carrying capacity for mosquito larvae in each patch","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mosquito-borne virus transmission through human-mosquito interaction","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assuming 80% efficacy of personal protective measures against mosquitos may lead to underestimation of transmission rates and disease spread.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Individuals continuously assess their protection status based on the adult mosquito population size and the prevalence of infected humans.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Aggregate average public demand for local-level vector control by authorities is dictated by the infected human population.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The modified ross-macdonald model reflects the specific case of zika virus in aedes aegypti mosquitos.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulties in implementing and maintaining broad-scale mosquito control programs due to financial and environmental considerations","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on personal protective measures in mosquito control efforts","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitations of population-level approach to vector control and lack of consideration for individual-level personal protection","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Wider range of suitable habitats for mosquito populations due to climate change","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Expanding urbanization, international travel, trade, and population growth contributing to potential for mosquito-borne disease outbreak","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of capacity for essential vector-control operations in community vector control organizations","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to infectious agents","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High agent exposure times","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of social distancing","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of transparency in the model-agnostic design may lead to inaccurate risk assessment.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of real-world variability in occupant behavior and building characteristics may lead to inaccurate exposure assessments.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate simulation of agent interactions may lead to underestimation of occupant exposure in confined spaces.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumptions necessary for the calibration of both the underlying crowd model and exposed","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
